metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1676 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
mount in util-linux 2.19 and earlier does not remove the /etc/mtab.tmp file after a failed attempt to add a mount entry, which allows local users to trigger corruption of the /etc/mtab file via multiple invocations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
No subscription required

libblkid1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libmount1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libuuid1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
mount - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
util-linux - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
util-linux-locales - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
uuid-runtime - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4').
util-linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4').
